page.title: 03Derwentwater and it's woods
page.content: Derwentwater is named the Queen of the lakes because it is known to be the most beautiful lake.Six landing stages are placed round the lake.Every year a sort of show is held on Derwent Island. The people are taken across on launches. Other Islands consist of Lords Island,St Herberts Island and Rampsholme Island.Derwentwater is one of the main attractions in the Lake District.Beatrix Potter's story Squirrel Nutkin is connected with St Herberts Island.The Old Wise Owl was meant to live on this island.Down at Keswick landing stages there is a gift shop,the National Trust shop,a cafe and The Century Theatre.We found out that Vicars Island was purchased in 1844 and that the floating islands came into sight in 1847.The floating islands are little islands in Lake Derwentwater,made of dead vegetation.
